No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 805, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- Calculators must not be used in this paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 588, 212, 601]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 74, 570, 90]]<|/det|>
List of formulas 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 106, 784, 125]]<|/det|>
Equation of a circle with centre \((a, b)\) and radius \(r\). \((x - a)^2 + (y - b)^2 = r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 155, 675, 173]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\). \(A = \pi rl\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 202, 685, 220]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(A = 4\pi r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 245, 680, 275]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid or cone, base area \(A\), height \(h\). \(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 295, 685, 323]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 349, 660, 367]]<|/det|>
Quadratic equation For the equation \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\), 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[394, 368, 563, 402]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 446, 228, 463]]<|/det|>
Binomial theorem 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[394, 435, 907, 477]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^n = a^n + \binom{n}{1} a^{n-1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n-2}b^2 + \dots + \binom{n}{r} a^{n-r}b^r + \dots + b^n,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[394, 483, 774, 522]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n-r)!r!}\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 556, 221, 572]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[394, 554, 670, 597]]<|/det|>
\[u_n = a + (n-1)d \\ S_n = \frac{1}{2}n(a+l) = \frac{1}{2}n\{2a+(n-1)d\}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 632, 221, 648]]<|/det|>
Geometric series 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[394, 630, 575, 710]]<|/det|>
\[u_n = ar^{n-1} \\ S_n = \frac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r} \quad (r \neq 1) \\ S_\infty = \frac{a}{1-r} \quad (|r| < 1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 741, 161, 757]]<|/det|>
Identities 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[394, 739, 560, 789]]<|/det|>
\[\begin{align*} \sin^2 A + \cos^2 A &= 1 \\ \sec^2 A &= 1 + \tan^2 A \\ \cos e^2 A &= 1 + \cot^2 A \end{align*}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[84, 829, 243, 845]]<|/det|>
Formulas for \(\Delta ABC\) 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[394, 824, 580, 900]]<|/det|>
\[\begin{align*} \frac{a}{\sin A} &= \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C} \\ a^2 &= b^2 + c^2 - 2bc \cos A \\ \Delta &= \frac{1}{2} ab \sin C \end{align*}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[333, 73, 666, 88]]<|/det|>
Calculators must not be used in this paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 102, 108, 118]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 102, 144, 118]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 120, 805, 448]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 467, 863, 483]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=(2 x+a)(x+b)(x+c)\) ，where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 496, 362, 512]]<|/det|>
Find values for \(a, b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 496, 916, 512]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 715, 136, 731]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 715, 586, 731]]<|/det|>
Use the graph to find the values of \(x\) for which \(y \geqslant 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 715, 916, 731]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 75, 104, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 75, 794, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(k\) for which the equation \(x^{2}+4 k x+k+3=0\) has two equal roots.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 916, 91]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 373, 104, 389]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 373, 689, 405]]<|/det|>
The polynomial p is such that \(\mathrm{p}(x)=x^{3}+A x+30\), where \(A\) is a constant. When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x+2\) the remainder is 84.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 419, 437, 435]]<|/det|>
Write \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) as a product of linear factors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 419, 916, 435]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[55, 32, 415, 68]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 73, 545, 89]]<|/det|>
<pre>Solutions by accurate drawing will not be accepted.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 102, 536, 120]]<|/det|>
<pre>A circle, \(C\), has equation \(\left(x- 5\right)^{2}+\left(y- 12\right)^{2}=100\).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 134, 184, 150]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 134, 597, 150]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to \(C\) at the point \((11,4)\).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 152, 718, 168]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in the form \(ax+by=c\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 152, 917, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 522, 136, 538]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 522, 718, 538]]<|/det|>
Show that \(C\) and the circle with equation \(x^{2}+y^{2}=4\) do not intersect.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 522, 917, 538]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 699, 88]]<|/det|>
In this question, all lengths are in centimetres and all angles are in radians.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[339, 99, 660, 232]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 255, 635, 271]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a sector of a circle with centre \(O\) and radius 6.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 285, 136, 301]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 285, 537, 301]]<|/det|>
It is given that the area of triangle \(A O B\) is \(9 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 316, 340, 332]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\sin \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 486, 136, 502]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 486, 742, 502]]<|/det|>
It is also given that the exact area of the shaded segment is \((15 \pi-9) \mathrm{cm}^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 517, 434, 533]]<|/det|>
Find the exact length of the arc \(A B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 517, 916, 533]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 73, 108, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[285, 95, 710, 272]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 300, 560, 325]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y=\frac{3}{x+1}-\frac{x-2}{x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 335, 905, 351]]<|/det|>
The points \(A\) and \(B\) lie on the curve such that the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) is 1 and the \(x\)-coordinate of \(B\) is 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 365, 136, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 365, 425, 381]]<|/det|>
Find the \(y\)-coordinates of \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 365, 916, 381]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 490, 136, 506]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 490, 780, 530]]<|/det|>
Show that the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(A B\) and the curve is \(\frac{a}{4}-\ln \frac{b}{2}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 916, 526]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 75, 101, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 75, 652, 91]]<|/det|>
The function f is defined by \(\mathrm{f}(x)=-2 x^{2}+9 x-10\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 107, 136, 124]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 107, 184, 124]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 107, 717, 124]]<|/det|>
Write \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in the form \(a+b(x+c)^{2}\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 107, 918, 124]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 386, 184, 402]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 386, 535, 402]]<|/det|>
Hence determine whether or not \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}\) exists.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 386, 918, 402]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 136, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 692, 91]]<|/det|>
The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x)=3 \ln (5-2 x)\) for \(0 \leqslant x<2.5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 105, 184, 121]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 105, 536, 121]]<|/det|>
On the axes, sketch the graph of \(y=\mathrm{g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 122, 918, 154]]<|/det|>
State the exact values of the intercepts with the coordinate axes and the equation of any asymptote. [3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[254, 166, 752, 530]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 558, 184, 574]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 558, 432, 574]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 558, 916, 574]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 742, 184, 758]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 742, 464, 758]]<|/det|>
Find the domain and range of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 759, 516, 775]]<|/det|>
Give each of your answers in exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 759, 916, 775]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[60, 30, 415, 330]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 344, 484, 360]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows four points, \(O, A, B\) and \(C\).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 368, 581, 395]]<|/det|>
\(A, B\) and \(C\) lie in a straight line and are such that \(\frac{AB}{AC} = \frac{1}{3}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 402, 290, 419]]<|/det|>
\(\overrightarrow{O A} = \mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{O B} = \mathbf{b}\) .  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 433, 387, 466]]<|/det|>
<pre>(a) Find \(\overrightarrow{O C}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\). Simplify your answer.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 32, 415, 64]]<|/det|>
 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 136, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 677, 88]]<|/det|>
The line \(OA\) is extended to the point \(D\) such that \(OA:AD=2:7\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 94, 465, 110]]<|/det|>
Point \(E\) lies on \(CD\) such that \(\overrightarrow{OE}=\lambda \mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 125, 314, 141]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\lambda\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 125, 920, 141]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 72, 678, 104]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line and passes through a fixed point \(O\). At time \(t\) seconds, its displacement from \(O, s\) metres, is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 115, 578, 134]]<|/det|>
\[
s=t+6 t^{2}-t^{3} \qquad \text { for } 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 3
\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 144, 778, 170]]<|/det|>
\[
s=12 t-\frac{1}{3} t^{2}-3 \qquad \text { for } 3 \leqslant t \leqslant k \qquad \text { where } k \text { is a constant. }
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 180, 814, 197]]<|/det|>
It is given that, for \(3 \leqslant t \leqslant k\), the velocity of \(P\) is positive and its acceleration is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 212, 136, 228]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 212, 532, 228]]<|/det|>
The maximum velocity of \(P\) occurs when \(t=2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 229, 858, 245]]<|/det|>
On the axes below, sketch a velocity–time graph for the first \(k\) seconds of the motion of \(P\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[257, 256, 748, 540]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 32, 415, 65]]<|/det|>
 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 136, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 622, 91]]<|/det|>
The total distance travelled by \(P\) for \(0 \leqslant t \leqslant k\) is 57 metres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 105, 918, 137]]<|/det|>
Given that when \(t=3\) the distance and displacement of \(P\) from \(O\) are equal, find the value of \(k\). [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[335, 896, 664, 912]]<|/det|>
<pre>Question 12 is printed on the next page.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 80, 115, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[134, 80, 852, 104]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve \(y=\frac{4}{x^{2}}+a x+7\) at the point where \(x=2\) has equation \(x+4 y=b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 113, 328, 128]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 113, 916, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
